column4: in evince, how do i view the yellow annotation notes i see on a PDF?
hey, can someone help me with evince?
hey, can someone help me with evince?
ok Gnea, in evince, how do i view the yellow annotation notes i see on a PDF?
gnea: it's like a yellow conversation bubble
bah!
aiight, i'll install adobe reader then
booooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo
open source FAILS AGAIN
lol
no, your professor assuming that everyone is going to pay for commercial tools is ... a tool.
no, it's not.
but that's not the fault of open source software. that's the fault of a professor choosing to distribute work in a non-standard file format that requires non-free tools to open.
Are PDFs not open?
PDFs with pop-up yellow post-it note bubbles to indicate edits certainly are not.
embrace, extend, extinguish. your yellow Post-It pop-ups represent the "extend" part of the formula. :)
ok, then how's this: is there an open source competitor to PDFs?
not so much "closed source" as "not open and not thoroughly documented"
file a feature request with Evince. that is bad bahavior.
do you have a link? I'll do it right now
http://bugzilla.gnome.org/
np np. thanks for filing feature requests rather than just saying "this sucks!" ;)
it does suck :P but i'll help make it not suck. i love ubuntu, i just get frustrated when it doesn't do things I don't like. which is rare. and usually quickly fixed, hahah!
Bug #515243, filed :)
